description.narrative: The project aims at scaling-up Multi-Hazard Early Warning System and the use of Climate Information in Georgia. GCF funded component.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
Impact level 1.0.1.1. Change in expected losses of lives and economic assets (US$) due to the impact of extreme climate-related disasters 1.0.1.2. Total Number of direct and indirect beneficiaries; Number of beneficiaries relative to total population
Outcome level A5.2 Number and level of effective coordination mechanisms A6.2 Use of climate information products/services in decision-making in climate-sensitive sectors by stakeholders A7.1 Use by vulnerable households, communities, business and public-sector services of Fund-supported tools, instruments, strategies and activities to respond to climate change and variability A7.2 Total Geographic coverage of climate related early warning systems and other risk reduction measures established/ strengthened
Output level 1.1. # of new hydro-meteorological monitoring equipment functionally operating 1.2 Number of river basins for which hazard and risk maps (covering landslides, mudflows, avalanches, hail storms and droughts), flood plain zoning and multi-hazard vulnerability and risk assessments 1.3 Level of application for systemic gender-sensitive socio-economic vulnerability assessment in decision-making and resilience investment prioritization 1.4 Level of application of a centralized multi-hazard disaster risk information and knowledge system 2.1 Level of institutional capacity for implementation of MHEWS and delivery of climate information amongst key government agencies 2.2 Status of the nation-wide MHEWS covering landslides, floods, mudflows, avalanches, hailstorms and droughts 2.3 % of farmers accessing improved climate forecasting services 3.1 Number and % of coverage for high-risk communities through CBEWS and CBCRM action. 3.2 % increase of crop yields and household income for targeted communities due to reduced losses and damages from hazards 3.3 Number of targeted beneficiaries reporting enhanced protection from climate related natural disasters resulting from Fund investments (disaggregated by gen

comment.narrative: 1.1/ a/ Procurement and installation of a telecommunication system; b/ Procurement and operationalization of HPC; c/ Observation equipment for 6 river basins (2 Automatic meteorological stations, 30 Automatic meteorological posts, 11 Automatic hydrological posts, 3 Snow Measurement equipment) d/ Procurement of 15 Agrometeorological Stations 1.2/ a/ Initiation of collection of LiDAR data b/ Initiation of development of hazard maps and risk profiles for 3 river basins: Supsa, Natanebi, Kintrishi. c/ Collection of hydro-meteorological and geological field data and processing of historical data for hazard-mapping for Enguri, Khobistskali and Mtkvari river basins (Mtkvari, within borders of Tbilisi). 1.3/ a/ Upgrading the GIS-based socio-economic model; b/ Socio-economic assessment for three river basins (Supsa, Natanebi, Kintrishi) completed. 1.4/ The conceptual design of the multi-hazard disaster risk information system (MHDRIS) developed. 2.1/ a/ Legal and Institutional frameworks for MHEWS and Capacity Assessment Report developed; b/ Capacity Development Plan developed and implemented c/ Awareness raising events in CCA/DRR conducted 2.2/ International technical advice delivered to NEA on: a/ Enhancing meteorological forecasting and satellite precipitation estimates; b/Providing service new source data/type into forecasting platform; c/Expanding flood forecasting platform (upgrading Rioni flood forecasting platform). 2.3/ Initiating preparatory activities. 3.1/ a/ Gender inputs provided on development of Capacity Assessment scorecard; b/ Gender inputs provided in documents regulating the legal and institutional frameworks for MHEWS and climate information issues c/ Gender inputs provided to implement Gender Action Plan (GAP) d/ Finalization of design of impact evaluation for non-structural measures 3.2/ No Targets 3.3/ a/ Project designs are developed for 2 structural measures and construction works initiated (LoA MRDI) b/ Additional surveys on Kobuleti site undertaken and construction initiated (LoA MRDI) 3.4/ a/ Training module on DRR/DRM, MHEWS, CBMHRM Developed b/ Education programs for youth developed (pre-school and university levels c/ Networking activities - community awards and community forum organized

1.1/ a, b, c/ tender for HPC, as well as tender for Observation equipment for 6 river basins (2 Automatic meteorological stations, 30 Automatic meteorological posts, 11 Automatic hydrological posts, 3 Snow Measurement equipment) has been announced. d/ Procurement of 15 Agrometeorological Stations and ICT system has been initiated 1.2/ a,b,c/ Development of hazard maps delayed. The project recruited a French company for the task, however, due to poor quality of the deliverables submitted and the failure of contract performance, the contract was terminated with the company. As a result, the project suffered significant delays in terms of development of the methodology for multi-hazard mapping and risk assessment, as well as completion of multi-hazard maps for 3 river basins. 1.3/ a, b/ In 2020 Unified Methodology of Gender-sensitive Socio-economic Vulnerability Assessment for multi-hazards and risks has been developed, however, due to the delays in development of hazard mapping the finalization is underway and thus methodology has not been presented with relevant stakeholders. 1.4/ In 2020 the conceptual design of the Multi Hazard Disaster Risk Information System has been developed. 2.1/ a, b, c/ The project started baseline capacity assessment, covering both institutional capacity assessment of each stakeholder, implemented by international and national experts in institutional capacity assessment and technical level capacity assessment to be supplemented by technical experts recruited within both projects. The team of experts developed initial capacity assessment report, based on the results further detailed assessment of institutional and technical capacities was initiated. 2.2/ a, b, c/ In 2020, Project started preparatory work related to the enhancement of meteorological forecasting, assessment of satellite precipitation estimates and acquisition and analysis of radar data for the inclusion into the forecasting platforms. A number of activities were also fulfilled for the achievement of operationalization of the Rioni River Flood Forecasting Platform. 2.3/Activity has not been started. 3.1/ a, b, c/ Interventions of CBEWS and CBCRM has not been started in 2020, due to the delays in development of risk maps. 3.2/ Baseline survey in the first 3 river basins of non-structural measures will be conducted in 2021. 3.3/ During 2020 preparatory works has been implemented such as a/ Preparation of Technical guidance document for the design of structural measures for the management for flood, landslide and other Risk Management structures at a national level b/ Initiation of review and update of the technical designs of structural measures for 5 sites as part of MRDI co-financing 3.4/ a, b, c/ Baseline numbers for the first 3 river basins in the areas of nun-structural measures will be defined in 2021

1.1/ 4 mobile discharge maters; 1 drone; 1 GPS 1.2/ Specific target: Historical data have been analysed for 6 basins and field work has been completed for 3 basins in 2019. 1.3/ Specific target: Report on review of existing socio-economic vulnerability and risk models and software, including recommended multi hazard socio-economic vulnerability and risk assessment modeling and mapping tool, in place 1.4/ Specific target: draft system design concept in place 2.1/ Specific target: The expert for capacity assessment and capacity development is on board. 2.2/ Specific target: Review of MHEWS institutional and legal frameworks will be conducted (report in place). 3.2/ Specific target: Baseline survey 3.3/ Specific target: Baseline survey 3.4/ Specific target: KAP survey baseline

1.1/ in 2019, procurement of mobile field equipment: 4 mobile discharge meters, 2 drones with additional corpus and 1 GPS, was carried out to support fieldwork under SDC project activities implemented by NEA, specifically, for collection of hydrological data, for identification snow avalanche risk zones, identification of geological processes. 1.2/under the LOA with NEA historical data processing and field works for data collection was initiated from April 2019 by NEA. As a result, historical climatological, hydrological, avalanche, geological, topographical and geological hazard data for Supsa, Natanebi, and Kintrishi river basins were processed. Field surveys were carried out in 3 river basins mentioned above. 1.3 In 2019 GCF project started the development of methodology and tools for gender-sensitive community-based socio-economic vulnerability assessment. Initial steps covered the assessment of data needs and its availability for vulnerability assessment related to different hazards (landslides, floods, mudflows, avalanches, hailstorms, windstorms, droughts) and socio-economic data. 1.4 In 2019 project started to implement preparatory work, for this purpose with the support of System and Technology and Forecasting and Early Warning, international experts GCF started to work on the conceptual framework of the centralized Multi-Hazard Disaster Risk Information System. 2.1/Under SDC co-financing project hired expert for capacity assessment and capacity development. The expert with team of experts in different technical fields started working on the template of the capacity assessment score cards that would identify the baseline capacities and gaps in each technical area and respective responsible agencies. 2.2/Intensive preparatory work has been conducted to identify the entry point for the introduction of upgraded Multi-Hazard Forecasting and Early Warning platform, such as: technical recommendations aimed at assessing the current status of national forecasting capacities and Immediate activities for the year 2020-2021. 3.2/ Survey to set baseline numbers for Impact evaluation of structural measures has been conducted. 3.3/ Survey to set baseline numbers for Impact evaluation of structural measures has been conducted. 3.4/Survey to set baseline numbers for Knowledge, Awareness and Practice (KAP) has been conducted.
